TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit RouteCollection extends System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection`1<class System.Web.Routing.RouteBase>
Public Class RouteCollection Inherits Collection(Of RouteBase)

summary.span: 为 ASP.NET 路由操作提供路由的集合。

span.span: Provides a collection of routes for ASP.NET routing.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 类提供了一些方法, 使你能够管理从类派生的对象的集合。 The class provides methods that enable you to manage a collection of objects that derive from the class. 通常`static` , 您将使用 类的属性来检索对象。Typically, you will use the `static` property of the class to retrieve a object. 属性存储 ASP.NET 应用程序的所有路由。The property stores all the routes for an ASP.NET application. ASP.NET 路由循环访问属性中的路由, 以查找与 URL 匹配的路由。ASP.NET routing iterates through the routes in the property to find the route that matches a URL. 若要构造 URL, 请调用方法并传入值的集合。To construct a URL, you call the method and pass in a collection of values. 方法查找其参数与你传入的值相匹配的第一个路由, 并返回一个对象, 其中包含有关匹配的路由的信息。 The method finds the first route with parameters that match the values that you passed in, and returns a object that contains information about the matching route. 通过 对象的属性检索 URL。You retrieve the URL through the property of the object. 可以使用名称或不带名称添加路由。You can add a route either with a name or without a name. 通过包含名称, 可以在构造 Url 时区分相似的路由。Including a name enables you to distinguish between similar routes when URLs are constructed. 如果未指定名称, ASP.NET 路由将使用集合中的第一个匹配路由来构造 URL。If you do not specify a name, ASP.NET routing uses the first matching route in the collection to construct a URL. 将未命名的路由添加到对象时, 无法添加集合中已经存在的路由。When you add an unnamed route to the object, you cannot add a route that already is in the collection. 添加命名路由时, 不能使用已经在集合中标识路由的名称。When you add a named route, you cannot use a name that already identifies a route in the collection. 使用 方法和方法可确保与集合交互, 而不会与其他进程发生冲突。You use the method and the method to make sure that you interact with the collection without conflicts from other processes. 有关如何向路由集合添加路由的详细信息, 请参阅[ASP.NET 路由](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/892441af-8f1d-483e-ab5f-b82c23576f5a)。For more information about how to add a route to a route collection, see [ASP.NET Routing](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/892441af-8f1d-483e-ab5f-b82c23576f5a).

summary.span: 向 对象末尾添加路由，并为该路由分配指定的名称。

span.span: Adds a route to the end of the object and assigns the specified name to the route.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用方法, 可以在将路由添加到路由集合时定义该路由的名称。The method enables you to define a name for a route when you add it to the route collection. 通过定义路由的名称, 可以指定使用路由构造 URL 时要使用的特定路由。By defining a name for the route, you can specify a particular route to use when you use routing to construct a URL. 如果有多个路由与传递给该方法的值匹配, 则指定特定路由非常重要。Specifying a particular route is important when more than one route matches the values that you pass to the method. 如果未指定命名路由, ASP.NET 路由将使用与值匹配的集合中的第一个路由。If you do not specify a named route, ASP.NET routing will use the first route in the collection that matches the values. 有关详细信息，请参阅[如何：从路由](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/1ffd4085-71f6-4822-be8f-f682ca638650)构造 url。For more information, see [How to: Construct URLs from Routes](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/1ffd4085-71f6-4822-be8f-f682ca638650). 名称只能在对象中使用一次。A name can be used only one time in the object. 如果无需指定路由的名称, 则可以通过调用方法来添加路由。If you do not have to specify a name for the route, you can add the route by calling the method. 使用方法和方法确保与集合进行交互, 而不会与其他进程发生冲突。Use the method and the method to make sure that you interact with the collection without conflicts from other processes. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何将路由添加到对象并为该路由分配一个名称。The following example shows how to add a route to a object and assign a name to the route. [!code-csharp[System.Web.Routing.RouteCollection.MapPageRoute#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/system.web.routing.routecollection.mappageroute/cs/global.asax#1)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Routing.RouteCollection.MapPageRoute#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/system.web.routing.routecollection.mappageroute/vb/global.asax#1)]

summary.span: 提供一个对象，用于管理在从集合中检索对象时的线程安全性。

span.span: Provides an object for managing thread safety when you retrieve an object from the collection.

returns.span: 用于管理线程安全性的对象。

span.span: An object that manages thread safety.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 对象可用于应用程序中的多个进程。The object is available to multiple processes in the application. 因此, 如果必须在应用程序运行时检索路由, 请使用方法来确保线程安全。Therefore, if you have to retrieve a route when the application is running, use the method in order to guarantee thread safety. 通过获取路由集合上的读取锁定, 可以确保在尝试检索集合时不会修改该集合。By obtaining a read lock on the route collection, you make sure that the collection will not be modified while you are trying to retrieve it. 方法停止线程继续, 直到可以获取锁。The method stops the thread from continuing until the lock can be acquired. 如果已有写入锁定, 则线程将等待, 直到更新完成并且写入锁被释放。If a write lock is in place, the thread waits until the update is completed and the write lock is released. 当释放此方法返回的对象时, 将释放路由集合上的读取锁定。The read lock on the route collection is released when the object that is returned by this method is disposed. 如果不使用, 则在读取集合时可能会收到错误。If you do not use , you might get an error while you are reading through the collection. 例如, 假设您循环遍历集合中的对象以进行读取, 而不调用。 For example, suppose you loop through the objects in the collection to read them, without calling . 当你执行此操作时, 另一个请求中的其他线程可能会调用并向集合添加路由。While you are doing that, another thread from another request might call and add a route to the collection. 第一个线程将失败并出现错误。The first thread will then fail with an error. 在以下两种情况下, 你无需调用:There are two scenarios in which you do not have to call : - 类的公共方法 (如) , 并在内部调用。Public methods of the class such as and call internally. 因此, 当您调用 类的公共方法从集合中检索数据时, 无需显式调用。Therefore, you do not have to explicitly call when you call a public method of the class to retrieve data from the collection. - 当应用程序正在启动, 并且尚未处理请求 (如`Application_Start`事件处理程序中) 时, 只有一个线程正在运行。When the application is starting and is not yet processing requests, such as in the `Application_Start` event handler, only one thread is running. 由于在您读取集合时没有其他线程可能更新该集合, 因此您无需调用。Because there are no other threads that might update the collection while you are reading it, you do not have to call . ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何在应用程序运行时检索路由时使用方法。The following example shows how to use the method when you retrieve a route while the application is running. 语句可确保在从集合中读取数据 (无论代码正常完成还是引发异常) 的运行时, 将安全地在`Using`代码块的末尾释放锁。 `Using`The `Using` statement ensures that no matter what happens at run time when you read from the collection (whether the code completes normally or an exception is thrown) the lock will be safely released at the end of the `Using` code block.

summary.span: 提供一个对象，用于管理在集合中添加或移除元素时的线程安全性。

span.span: Provides an object for managing thread safety when you add or remove elements in the collection.

returns.span: 用于管理线程安全性的对象。

span.span: An object that manages thread safety.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在 ASP.NET 应用程序中定义路由的建议方法是将路由添加到 global.asax 文件中`Application_Start`事件的事件处理程序中的属性。The recommended approach for defining routes in an ASP.NET application is to add the routes to the property in an event handler for the `Application_Start` event in the Global.asax file. 有关详细信息，请参阅 。For more information, see . 如果在应用程序运行时必须添加路由, 请使用方法来确保线程安全。If you have to add a route when the application is running, you use the method to guarantee thread safety. 当释放此方法返回的对象时, 将释放路由集合上的写入锁。The write lock on the route collection is released when the object that is returned by this method is disposed. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何在应用程序运行时添加路由时使用方法。The following example shows how to use the method when you add a route while the application is running.

span.span: ASP.NET Routing

summary.span: 定义不需检查是否匹配路由的 URL 模式。

span.span: Defines a URL pattern that should not be checked for matches against routes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法创建映射到路由处理程序的路由。This method creates a route that is mapped to the route handler. 调用此方法后, 匹配指定 URL 模式的请求将不会作为路由请求处理。After you call this method, requests that match the specified URL pattern will not be processed as route requests. 当 URL 与物理文件 (如图像文件) 匹配时, ASP.NET 路由会自动忽略请求。ASP.NET routing automatically ignores requests when the URL matches a physical file, such as an image file. 在某些情况下, 你可能还希望路由在没有物理文件时忽略请求。In some cases you might also want routing to ignore requests when there is no physical file. 例如, 即使没有与 axd 文件扩展名相对应的物理文件, 也不应将 ASP.NET 自动对 axd 文件进行的请求视为路由请求。For example, the requests that ASP.NET automatically makes for .axd files should not be treated as route requests even though there is no physical file that corresponds to the .axd file-name extension.

span.span: ASP.NET Routing

summary.span: 定义不需检查是否匹配路由的 URL 模式。

span.span: Defines a URL pattern that should not be checked for matches against routes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法创建映射到路由处理程序的路由。This method creates a route that is mapped to the route handler. 调用此方法后, 匹配指定 URL 模式的请求将不会作为路由请求处理。After you call this method, requests that match the specified URL pattern will not be processed as route requests. 当 URL 与物理文件 (如图像文件) 匹配时, ASP.NET 路由会自动忽略请求。ASP.NET routing automatically ignores requests when the URL matches a physical file, such as an image file. 在某些情况下, 你可能还希望路由在没有物理文件时忽略请求。In some cases you might also want routing to ignore requests when there is no physical file. 例如, 即使没有与 axd 文件扩展名相对应的物理文件, 也不应将 ASP.NET 自动对 axd 文件进行的请求视为路由请求。For example, the requests that ASP.NET automatically makes for .axd files should not be treated as route requests even though there is no physical file that corresponds to the .axd file-name extension. ## Examples MVC 项目的默认模板使用此方法从路由中排除 axd 文件, 如以下示例中所示:The default template for MVC projects uses this method to exclude .axd files from routing, as shown in the following example: [!code-csharp[MvcDefaultApp#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/mvcdefaultapp/cs/global.asax.cs#2)] [!code-vb[MvcDefaultApp#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/mvcdefaultapp/vb/global.asax.vb#2)]

span.span: ASP.NET Routing

member this.Ignore : string * obj -> unit

param.name: url
param.span: 要忽略的 URL 模式。

span.span: The URL pattern to be ignored.

param.name: constraints
param.span: 附加条件，用于确定是否忽略匹配 URL 模式的请求。

span.span: Additional criteria that determine whether a request that matches the URL pattern will be ignored.

summary.span: 定义一个 URL 模式，此模式在请求 URL 满足指定约束的情况下不需要检查 URL 是否与路由匹配。

span.span: Defines a URL pattern that should not be checked for matches against routes if a request URL meets the specified constraints.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法创建映射到路由处理程序的路由。This method creates a route that is mapped to the route handler. 调用此方法后, 匹配指定 URL 模式的请求将不会作为路由请求处理。After you call this method, requests that match the specified URL pattern will not be processed as route requests. 当 URL 与物理文件 (如图像文件) 匹配时, ASP.NET 路由会自动忽略请求。ASP.NET routing automatically ignores requests when the URL matches a physical file, such as an image file. 在某些情况下, 你可能还希望路由在没有物理文件时忽略请求。In some cases you might also want routing to ignore requests when there is no physical file. 例如, 即使没有与 axd 文件扩展名相对应的物理文件, 也不应将 ASP.NET 自动对 axd 文件进行的请求视为路由请求。For example, the requests that ASP.NET automatically makes for .axd files should not be treated as route requests even though there is no physical file that corresponds to the .axd file-name extension. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用此方法忽略扩展名为 .aspx 的所有 Url。The following example shows how to use this method to ignore all URLs that have an .aspx extension. 如果注册自定义 HTTP 处理程序来处理扩展名为 ".aspx" 的文件的所有 Url, 则可能需要执行此操作。You might want to do this if you register a custom HTTP handler to handle all URLs for files that have the extension ".aspx". 匹配所有 .aspx 请求的单一 URL 模式需要两个通用参数, `{*path}.aspx/{*pathinfo}`例如。A single URL pattern that would match all .aspx requests would require two catchall parameters such as `{*path}.aspx/{*pathinfo}`. (此模式将匹配所有以 .aspx 结尾的 URL, 包括具有查询字符串参数的 URL。)但是, 路由只允许末尾有一个容器。(This pattern would match any URL that ends in .aspx, including those that have query-string parameters.) However, routing allows only one catchall parameter at the end. 作为替代方法, 您可以指定一个 URL 模式, 该 URL 模式具有与所有 Url 匹配的单个内参数, 然后指定排除不具有 .aspx 扩展名的所有内容的约束, 如以下示例中所示:As an alternative, you can specify a URL pattern that has a single catchall parameter that matches all URLs and then specify constraints that exclude everything that does not have the .aspx extension, as shown in the following example: ```vb routes.Ignore("{*allaspx}", new With {.allaspx = ".*\.aspx(/.*)?"}) ``` ```csharp routes.Ignore("{*allaspx}", new {allaspx=@".*\.aspx(/.*)?"}); ``` 之前的代码行将通常添加到从 global.asax 中的`Application_Start`方法调用的方法中, 如重载的示例中所示。The previous line of code would typically be added to a method that is called from the `Application_Start` method in the Global.asax, as shown in the example for the overload.

span.span: The parameter is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 将未命名的路由添加到对象时, 无法添加集合中已经存在的路由。When you add an unnamed route to the object, you cannot add a route that already is in the collection. 使用方法和方法确保与集合进行交互, 而不会与其他进程发生冲突。Use the method and the method to make sure that you interact with the collection without conflicts from other processes.

span.span: is .
is already in the collection.

span.span: to convert URLs to lower case; otherwise .
The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果 URL 中包含了查询字符串, 则 URL 的此部分不会转换为小写。If a query string is included in the URL, that part of the URL is not converted to lower case.

summary.span: 提供用于定义 Web 窗体应用程序的路由的方法。

span.span: Provides a way to define routes for Web Forms applications.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 提供此方法是为了便于编码。This method is provided for coding convenience. 它等效于调用方法并传递使用类创建的对象。It is equivalent to calling the method and passing a object that is created by using the class. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用此方法为 Web 窗体应用程序定义路由。The following example shows how to define routes for a Web Forms application by using this method. 该示例显示了一个名`RegisterRoutes`为的方法, `Application_Start`该方法在 global.asax 文件中从调用。The example shows a method named `RegisterRoutes` that is called from `Application_Start` in the Global.asax file. 方法使用的每个重载将路由添加到应用程序。The method uses each overload of to add a route to the application. 有关如何为 Web 窗体应用程序定义路由的详细信息, [请参阅如何:定义 Web 窗体应用程序](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/200fe812-d0a6-4531-b9b4-cfc4ee83a678)的路由。For more information about how to define routes for Web Forms applications, see [How to: Define Routes for Web Forms Applications](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/200fe812-d0a6-4531-b9b4-cfc4ee83a678). summary.span: 获取或设置一个值，该值指示 ASP.NET 路由操作是否应处理与现有文件匹配的 URL。

span.span: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether ASP.NET routing should handle URLs that match an existing file.

value.span: 如果 ASP.NET 路由操作处理所有请求（甚至包括与现有文件匹配的请求），则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if ASP.NET routing handles all requests, even those that match an existing file; otherwise, .
The default value is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 尽管此值可以动态更改, 但在激活服务后所做的任何更改都将在使用 ASP.NET 路由集成时被忽略。Although this value can be changed dynamically, any change made after a service has been activated will be ignored when using ASP.NET routing integration. 有关详细信息, 请参阅[ASP.NET 路由集成](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=195235)。For more information, see [ASP.NET Routing Integration](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=195235).
